line_1: 'Tis done — he steps into the welcome chaise,
line_2: Lolls at his ease behind four handsome bays,

line_1: Take Journies in it like a Chaise;
line_2: Or Harness'd to a Nag, at ease

line_1: Now Tim and Bet, in hack post chaise,
line_2: Set out for Scotland in two days;

line_1: Behold him seated in his chaise;
Thro' Anglesea's island we rattle our chaise,
line_2: While the goats all in wonder seem on us to gaze;

line_1: His skill in coachmanship or driving chaise,
line_2: In bilking tavern bills and spouting plays,

line_1: When or on Post-Horse, or in Chaise,
line_2: With much Expence, and little Ease,
